# Mixins and modules for our Ruby blog application

# Module for timestamping functionality
module Timestampable
  def self.included(base)
    base.extend(ClassMethods)
    base.class_eval do
      attr_accessor :created_at, :updated_at
    end
  end
  
  module ClassMethods
    def with_timestamps
      puts "#{self.name} includes timestamp tracking"
    end
  end
  
  def touch
    @updated_at = Time.now
  end
  
  def age_in_seconds
    return 0 unless @created_at
    Time.now - @created_at
  end
end

# Module for validation functionality
module Validatable
  def self.included(base)
    base.extend(ClassMethods)
  end
  
  module ClassMethods
    def validate(field, &block)
      validations[field] = block
    end
    
    def validations
      @validations ||= {}
    end
  end
  
  def valid?
    errors.clear
    self.class.validations.each do |field, validation|
      value = instance_variable_get("@#{field}")
      error = validation.call(value)
      errors[field] = error if error
    end
    errors.empty?
  end
  
  def errors
    @errors ||= {}
  end
end

# Module for serialization
module Serializable
  def to_hash
    instance_variables.each_with_object({}) do |var, hash|
      key = var.to_s.delete('@').to_sym
      value = instance_variable_get(var)
      hash[key] = serialize_value(value)
    end
  end
  
  def to_json
    require 'json'
    to_hash.to_json
  end
  
  private
  
  def serialize_value(value)
    case value
    when Array
      value.map { |v| v.respond_to?(:to_hash) ? v.to_hash : v }
    when Time
      value.iso8601
    else
      value.respond_to?(:to_hash) ? value.to_hash : value
    end
  end
end

# Module for ID generation
module Identifiable
  def self.included(base)
    base.extend(ClassMethods)
  end
  
  module ClassMethods
    def next_id
      @id_counter ||= 0
      @id_counter += 1
    end
    
    def reset_id_counter!
      @id_counter = 0
    end
  end
  
  def assign_id
    @id ||= self.class.next_id
  end
end

class BaseModel

# User model
class User < BaseModel
  attr_accessor :username, :email, :role
  attr_reader :id, :password_hash
  
  # Class method to track all users
  @@all_users = []
  
  validate :username do |value|
    'Username is required' if value.nil? || value.empty?
  end
  
  validate :email do |value|
    'Invalid email format' unless value =~ /\A[\w+\-.]+@[a-z\d\-.]+\.[a-z]+\z/i
  end
  
  def initialize(username:, email:, password:, role: :reader)
    super()
    @username = username
    @email = email
    @role = role
    self.password = password
    @@all_users << self
  end
  
  def password=(new_password)
    require 'digest'
    @password_hash = Digest::SHA256.hexdigest(new_password)
  end
  
  def authenticate(password)
    require 'digest'
    Digest::SHA256.hexdigest(password) == @password_hash
  end
  
  def admin?
    @role == :admin
  end
  
  def author?
    [:admin, :author].include?(@role)
  end
  
  def self.all
    @@all_users
  end
  
  def self.find_by_username(username)
    @@all_users.find { |user| user.username == username }
  end
  
  def self.find(id)
    @@all_users.find { |user| user.id == id }
  end
end

# Post model
class Post < BaseModel
  attr_accessor :title, :content, :published, :tags
  attr_reader :id, :author
  
  @@all_posts = []
  
  validate :title do |value|
    'Title is required' if value.nil? || value.empty?
  end
  
  validate :content do |value|
    if value.nil? || value.empty?
      'Content is required'
    elsif value.length < 10
      'Content must be at least 10 characters'
    end
  end
  
  def initialize(title:, content:, author:, tags: [])
    super()
    @title = title
    @content = content
    @author = author
    @published = false
    @tags = tags
    @@all_posts << self
  end
  
  def publish!
    @published = true
    touch
    self
  end
  
  def unpublish!
    @published = false
    touch
    self
  end
  
  def published?
    @published
  end
  
  def word_count
    @content.split(/\s+/).size
  end
  
  def reading_time
    # Average reading speed: 200 words per minute
    (word_count / 200.0).ceil
  end
  
  def summary(length = 100)
    return @content if @content.length <= length
    @content[0...length].gsub(/\s\w+$/, '...') # Clean word break
  end
  
  def add_tag(tag)
    @tags << tag unless @tags.include?(tag)
    @tags
  end
  
  def self.all
    @@all_posts
  end
  
  def self.published
    @@all_posts.select(&:published?)
  end
  
  def self.by_author(author)
    @@all_posts.select { |post| post.author == author }
  end
  
  def self.with_tag(tag)
    @@all_posts.select { |post| post.tags.include?(tag) }
  end
end

# Comment model with nested structure support
class Comment < BaseModel
  attr_accessor :content, :post, :author, :parent
  attr_reader :id, :replies
  
  @@all_comments = []
  
  validate :content do |value|
    'Comment cannot be empty' if value.nil? || value.empty?
  end
  
  def initialize(content:, post:, author:, parent: nil)
    super()
    @content = content
    @post = post
    @author = author
    @parent = parent
    @replies = []
    parent.add_reply(self) if parent
    @@all_comments << self
  end
  
  def reply(content:, author:)
    Comment.new(content: content, post: @post, author: author, parent: self)
  end
  
  def add_reply(comment)
    @replies << comment
  end
  
  def root?
    @parent.nil?
  end
  
  def depth
    root? ? 0 : @parent.depth + 1
  end
  
  def thread
    root? ? [self] + all_replies : @parent.thread
  end
  
  def all_replies
    @replies + @replies.flat_map(&:all_replies)
  end
  
  def self.all
    @@all_comments
  end
  
  def self.for_post(post)
    @@all_comments.select { |comment| comment.post == post }
  end
end

# Service classes for our Ruby blog application
require_relative 'models'

# Blog service for managing posts and interactions
class BlogService
  class PublishError < StandardError; end
  class AuthorizationError < StandardError; end
  
  def initialize
    @observers = []
  end
  
  # Observer pattern for notifications
  def attach(observer)
    @observers << observer
  end
  
  def notify(event, data)
    @observers.each { |observer| observer.update(event, data) }
  end
  
  # Create a new post with authorization check
  def create_post(author:, title:, content:, tags: [])
    raise AuthorizationError, "User cannot create posts" unless author.author?
    
    post = Post.new(
      author: author,
      title: title,
      content: content,
      tags: tags
    )
    
    if post.valid?
      notify(:post_created, post)
      post
    else
      raise PublishError, "Invalid post: #{post.errors}"
    end
  end
  
  # Publish a post with validation
  def publish_post(post, user)
    raise AuthorizationError, "Only authors can publish" unless user.author?
    raise AuthorizationError, "Can only publish own posts" unless post.author == user || user.admin?
    raise PublishError, "Post is invalid" unless post.valid?
    
    post.publish!
    notify(:post_published, post)
    post
  end
  
  # Add comment with threading support
  def add_comment(post:, author:, content:, parent: nil)
    comment = Comment.new(
      post: post,
      author: author,
      content: content,
      parent: parent
    )
    
    if comment.valid?
      notify(:comment_added, comment)
      comment
    else
      raise "Invalid comment: #{comment.errors}"
    end
  end
  
  # Search posts using blocks
  def search_posts(query = nil, &block)
    posts = Post.published
    
    if block_given?
      posts.select(&block)
    elsif query
      posts.select do |post|
        post.title.downcase.include?(query.downcase) ||
        post.content.downcase.include?(query.downcase) ||
        post.tags.any? { |tag| tag.downcase.include?(query.downcase) }
      end
    else
      posts
    end
  end
  
  # Get trending posts
  def trending_posts(limit: 5)
    Post.published
        .sort_by { |post| -calculate_trend_score(post) }
        .take(limit)
  end
  
  private
  
  def calculate_trend_score(post)
    age_hours = post.age_in_seconds / 3600.0
    comments_count = Comment.for_post(post).size
    
    # Simple trending algorithm
    (comments_count + 1) / (age_hours + 2) ** 1.5
  end
end

# Analytics service for blog statistics
class AnalyticsService
  def self.generate_report
    {
      users: user_stats,
      posts: post_stats,
      engagement: engagement_stats
    }
  end
  
  def self.user_stats
    users = User.all
    {
      total: users.size,
      by_role: users.group_by(&:role).transform_values(&:size),
      most_active: most_active_authors(3)
    }
  end
  
  def self.post_stats
    posts = Post.all
    published = posts.select(&:published?)
    
    {
      total: posts.size,
      published: published.size,
      draft: posts.size - published.size,
      avg_word_count: published.empty? ? 0 : published.sum(&:word_count) / published.size,
      popular_tags: popular_tags(5)
    }
  end
  
  def self.engagement_stats
    comments = Comment.all
    posts_with_comments = comments.map(&:post).uniq
    
    {
      total_comments: comments.size,
      posts_with_comments: posts_with_comments.size,
      avg_comments_per_post: posts_with_comments.empty? ? 0 : comments.size.to_f / posts_with_comments.size,
      comment_threads: comments.select(&:root?).size
    }
  end
  
  def self.most_active_authors(limit)
    Post.all
        .group_by(&:author)
        .transform_values(&:size)
        .sort_by { |_, count| -count }
        .take(limit)
        .map { |author, count| { username: author.username, posts: count } }
  end
  
  def self.popular_tags(limit)
    Post.all
        .flat_map(&:tags)
        .tally
        .sort_by { |_, count| -count }
        .take(limit)
        .to_h
  end
end

# Notification observer for blog events
class NotificationObserver
  def initialize(name)
    @name = name
  end
  
  def update(event, data)
    timestamp = Time.now.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
    
    case event
    when :post_created
      puts "[#{timestamp}] #{@name}: New post '#{data.title}' by #{data.author.username}"
    when :post_published
      puts "[#{timestamp}] #{@name}: Post '#{data.title}' published!"
    when :comment_added
      puts "[#{timestamp}] #{@name}: New comment by #{data.author.username} on '#{data.post.title}'"
    end
  end
end

# Feed generator using duck typing
class FeedGenerator
  def self.generate(items, format: :summary)
    items.map do |item|
      if item.respond_to?(:title) && item.respond_to?(:summary)
        # It's a post
        format_post(item, format)
      elsif item.respond_to?(:content) && item.respond_to?(:author)
        # It's a comment
        format_comment(item, format)
      else
        # Unknown type, use generic formatting
        format_generic(item)
      end
    end
  end
  
  def self.format_post(post, format)
    case format
    when :summary
      {
        type: 'post',
        title: post.title,
        summary: post.summary(150),
        author: post.author.username,
        reading_time: "#{post.reading_time} min read",
        published: post.published?
      }
    when :full
      post.to_hash
    end
  end
  
  def self.format_comment(comment, format)
    {
      type: 'comment',
      content: comment.content[0..100],
      author: comment.author.username,
      post_title: comment.post.title,
      depth: comment.depth
    }
  end
  
  def self.format_generic(item)
    {
      type: 'unknown',
      data: item.respond_to?(:to_hash) ? item.to_hash : item.to_s
    }
  end
end
